Reviews.Title: “Quiet and pleasant rooms, excellent reception, average breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BuendnerUnterwegs
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights there for a business event, and for time reasons I did not check fitness or pool. The hotel is confortable and well run, associates are very willing to help on anything and our conference went smoot from all perspectives. The breakfast is only average, besides bread/butter and some fruits, the rest is mostly sugary and fatty (tried scrambled eggs and a sausage). It is ok, but I wouldn't go for anything else than business.

Reviews.Title: “Staff: A, Facility: C- despite remodel”
Reviews.Author: rtkidd88
Reviews.Content: New bed, TV, furniture and staff were great but lots of details need to be sorted (sink hot water not working, loose faucets, scratchy windows, my key didn't work a number of places they should have). The beds were VERY comfortable and the staff were attentive to issues raised. I didn't like the construction outside the pool and below my room though I am an spg platinum member. This wasn't an issue at night but I have a higher standard for Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Franchise35
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in April. We were told that the hotel was just renovated a few weeks ago. The lobby is sparkling and the bar/restaurant (The Front Yard) was VERY nice and a grat place to hang out in the hotel (The Build Your Own Burgers were fabulous!). Staff and room quality was the same as a typical Sheraton hotel. The rooms were very spacious and very clean. Only minor issue was the configuration on the bathroom door (which almost smacked into the toilet when you opened it all the way). The location was good as it is just a few blocks away from a huge shopping mall (Galleria) and tons of restaurants. The only complaint is the freeway construction right in front of the hotel (the hotel is on a frontage road so a bit tricky to navigate). They also have a complimentary breakfast for guests which was quite good! (hot and cold items and plenty of choice)

Reviews.Title: “Basically now an entirely new hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirker
Reviews.Content: Well, it looks like I'm the first one to review the newly reopened Sheraton, which had been closed for six months for a comprehensive re-do and which reopened about ten days prior to my visit. First, I'll just say that nearly all of the previous complaints about the place, specifically that it "felt old," are obsolete. I've stayed at plenty of five-star and boutique hotels, and the new Sheraton lobby (including its multiple dining and bar areas) is, quite simply, a stunner. VERY stylish decor, though not in an overtly trendy manor (well, except for the filament lights above the bar, a design element well past the point of cliche at this stage), and they even have nifty Android tablets on which you can (at check-in) flip through everything the hotel offers and (at the bar) flip through the entire food and cocktail menu. Speaking of the latter, it has a host of concoctions clearly designed by a talented mixologist that would put many of the country's so-called "speakeasies" to shame -- and at reasonable prices to boot, with most in the $7-$8 range. Even more surprisingly, this is one of the very few hotel bars I've encountered that had actually attracted a sizable crowd on a weeknight -- no easy feat, as most hoteliers can tell you. As for the rooms ... well, unfortunately they're nowhere near the design level of the lobby, even though they've been redone floor to ceiling. The first problem is an inherent and almost entirely unavoidable one when you're renovating a '70s-era property: the ceilings are low (7.5 feet, with the bathroom closer to 7) and the bathroom is pretty much miniscule, undoubtedly because it would've been cost-prohibitive to expand it or even change the basic location of its plumbing elements (tub, toilet and sink). The bigger problem, however, is that Sheraton somehow cheaped out on its room decor, with the notable exception of the bed, which is as good as any Starwood one I've slept in short of Westin's famous Heavenly Bed. There's a dinky 32" flatscreen TV -- a stark contrast to the 42" models you'll find at Aloft Hotels, which are supposed to be below Sheraton on the Starwood totem-pole chain -- and the decor is only interesting if you're into *a lot* of beige and browns. Worse still, the rooms lose major brownie points for failure to make them comfortable and convenient for business travelers. Not only does this property have the "free lobby wi-fi, but $11/day for the privilege of using it in your room" mentality that always befuddles me when I encounter it, but during the course of the remake the hotel failed to install the most basic thing a traveler needs: electrical outlets. The *only* one I could find that wasn't behind a bed, desk or dresser was in an electrical strip awkwardly taped to the bottom of the desk, and I had to climb under it to get to it. (Note that only one outlet on the strip was free, never mind that the average business traveler usually needs two minimum, and preferably three or four.) Alright, getting back to the good points: service all-around was remarkable considering the hotel's newness, with very prompt check-in (including meeting my request for a high-floor king room away from the elevators and not facing the adjacent freeway, even though I was traveling on a Priceline rate) and restaurant/bar service. The hotel serves a free hot breakfast, which I appreciated to the umpteenth degree, and offers an array of touch-screen computers in the lobby; I'm not sure if you can access the full Internet on them, but you can certainly print out boarding passes and the like. Although I admittedly hate paying for parking, which is mandatory here even for self-parking (to be fair, it's a fairly small lot, and there aren't any street-parking spots in the immediate vicinity), the cost ($10/night, with unlimited in and out) seemed like a bargain compared to its nearby sister Starwood hotels, the Westin Galleria and Le Meridien, which have the audacity to charge $18/day when you can just as easily park in the mall garage for free. I'd definitely recommend the hotel, particularly at the obscenely low rate I paid on Priceline, but two caveats: first, the I-635 freeway adjacent to the hotel is in the midst of a substantial expansion, and the area will likely be congested and filled with construction vehicles for the next several years. Also, as already noted, the hotel is indeed confusing to get to. I happened to know how to get there only because I lived in Dallas for 13 years, but basically you have to take 635 (a.k.a. the LBJ Freeway) to get there. Heading east down the freeway, as you would if you were traveling from either of the areas two airports (DFW and Love Field), you'd get off at Dallas Parkway (essentially the access road for the Dallas North Tollway) and make a u-turn onto the 635 access road. Heading west it's probably easiest to take the Alpha Rd. exit and continue along the access road until you get to the hotel. I'm sure a GPS system or a smartphone equipped with voice navigation would help as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location, management misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: Hard to find with all the access roads in and around dallas freeways, the main problem was at check-in and out, had zero knowledge that I was a platinum spg member, in addition was put in a regular hotel room which im not mad about directly next to two elevators like i redeved it through a travel discout site which i didn't. Room was ok nothing special with loud noises all day and night from hallway corridor and elevators dinging. Need a car to get anywhere at this sheraton property.

Reviews.Title: “A quick "staycation"”
Reviews.Author: irulanrae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I frequently stay in hotels for a quick weekend getaway. We chose to say at this Sheraton just to try a place we had never been. From the outside this particular Sheraton looks a bit sketchy. Once you walk in the lobby it is nice. I believe we stayed on the 9th floor. The room was small but we werenâ€™t looking for anything spacious. The room felt very cozy. The dÃ©cor and furniture complimented the room very well. The carpet and certain aspects of the bathroom seemed a bit dated but that was my only complaint. There was a flat panel TV and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is located directly in front of 635 but there was little traffic. We did have a chance to enjoy the pool. It was very basic and rather small. There was nothing visually appealing about the pool area. This Sheraton seemed to appeal to more of an older crowd. I wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel as a first choice for a family with small children. There was free parking and the hotel was priced very well. $70 per night for a King. Overall, I would say this hotel was nothing special. I would describe it as a step above your average LaQuinta or Holiday Inn. We enjoyed our stay and would not mind staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tgreen08
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel;however, I expected the hotel to be a little nicer due to it being the Shearton. It was a little out-dated and the bathroom was very small. However, the hotel was centrally located to Arlington which allowed us to get to the Cowboys Stadium in no time.

Reviews.Title: “It's an old hotel being run on a shoestring....”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveler99
Reviews.Content: We drove in late from San Antonio but never expected that a Sheraton Hotel would not have any food whatsoever! We had a suite and it did not have a minibar. Our first warning should have been when the person on duty told us that the back entrance from the parking lot did NOT lock ever...and it was unattended! Low ceilings, Small rooms, old fixtures and furniture the place is definately dated....we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas North”
Reviews.Author: chuck29355
Reviews.Content: Room was small, bathroom tiny, and bathroom sink made loud gargling noises when every another room put something down the drain. A high floor got me a nice veiw of the freeway and the noise that came with it. Staff was nice except for the cleaning lady that scolded me for still being there at 12 45 when front desk had prev approved a 1 pm check out. As i speak the outside is being painted and the pool area complete overhaul. Should be nice outside when done. The jackhammers stopped at dark in the pool area. During my stay they had the hotel priced pretty fair and feel the value was fair. Parking was free during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “mehhh...”
Reviews.Author: chawk610
Reviews.Content: Nothing special here... not particularly nice. Counter staff was a bit testy. I would stay here again if it were the only choice. Parking is rediculously $$$$. 21.00 to self park, and 29.99 to vallet.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Luxury in Busy Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller2576
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Dallas at this lovely hotel, before a long flight back home. We found a very clean, comfortable room with a great bed and linen, and had achieved a really good price online. No breakfast or wifi included but parking was free. Close to Galleria and good shopping, and easy access to the freeway.No traffic noise either, even though we were close to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “OU vs. Texas Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kcooks25
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Sheraton and we had a wonderful time. The hotel was nice and clean the staff was very friendly and helpful. To all who have never been to Dallas, during this period it is totally crazy. Some of the other guest where a little loud; but that is to be expected during this weekend. We will definately stay again...................................

Reviews.Title: “Great place I'd definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Marlo1019
Reviews.Content: Great hotel we booked on hotwire so I felt it was a great value for what we paid! Wish the WiFi had been free...that would be my only recommendation for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ghetto Hotel and Charges for bottled water in room without knowing...”
Reviews.Author: V G
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk, the Bellman and the restaurance wait staff was very nice! But they charged me for two bottles of water that was sitting with the complimentary coffee! No sign or price on them so one would assume it was complimentary! Guess again! The hotel inside was clean; however, the bathroom in our room had the tank of toliet leaning against the wall, the wallpaper was coming apart at the seams, the paint was chipping and the door of the bathroom only had less than half of an inch to clear the toliet. The bathroom was very, very small and hot, no ventilation! The hotel is next to the highway and not in a great area... you would think it would be as it was near the Galleria but there was a syringe in the parking lot next to our car when we got out so what does that tell you about the area? In addition, the elevators are soooooooooo slow! No free wifi here, it is $7.95 and the pool is under construction! Would never reccommend this ghetto hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MandyGandy
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline's name your own price feature and ended up with the Sheraton Dallas North for a great price. The staff were great, very friendly. The rooms were clean and spacious, and the bed was comfortable. This is an older hotel, but has been nicely maintained. The location was also great. A few blocks away from the Galleria and lots of other shopping. I was afraid the hotel would be difficult to access because of the location. However, when we got there we quickly found the back way in and out, making access much easier. Traffic was heavy in the area on the weekday, but the weekend was much better. Do not expect free internet in the room. The bathrooms are very tiny! Definitely not room for two to get ready at once. There was a restaurant on site that we did not try, but it was nice to have the option. There is also other dinning close by. We would definitely stay here again, but not for the full published price. Mostly because of the charge for internet in the rooms. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: georgiaapple
Reviews.Content: The staff was very good. The hotel was OK. The location good. I had one issue with the Toliet, could not flush. Someone was sent up quickly and fixed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: hamsterapm
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. It is in a great location near the Galleria. The room was clean and well maintained. We stayed at this hotel for our sons 4th birthday because he wanted to stay in a hotel. :) I would recommend this hotel, please keep in mind that they do not have free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Journeyman Service”
Reviews.Author: Americanrm
Reviews.Content: Attended one week seminar requiring early morning starts. Hotel restaurant served a wonderful buffet breakfast that made the mere thought of going out seem silly. Room was well appointed. Beds were a small slice of heaven... extremely comfortable. Over-all, the property and the staff were superior. Downfall was pricing of amenities, which was excessive - but no more than one might expect today. So, if you have to spend a week in Dallas with little opportunity to get out and about, this hotel can be counted on to take good care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: evadninorc
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable but nothing extraordinary. The elevator would not work unless you had key card so if it was full of people took a while for everyone to swipe. If I had kids going to the pool etc it would have been very inconvenient. Right off highway but not easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Escape to”
Reviews.Author: SKLKCK
Reviews.Content: After several hours of driving arriving at this hotel was a blessing! The man working the front desk was friendly, helpful, and recognized we were worn out! He quickly got us into a room that was lovely - quiet and comfortable. We had a good night's sleep before heading home the next morning. We appreciated all of the staff for making this a pleasurable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ione_almeida
Reviews.Content: The room was big and comfy (I stayed at the "Preferred Guest" floor, not sure if that changes anything). The staff is always ready to help, lovely people. The restaurant is also very nice, great food (although the variety of dishes could be improved). Very close to the Galleria Mall (less than 10 minutes walking). LBJ traffic is so high and noisy, but still the room is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Across freeway from Galleria”
Reviews.Author: kjhMN
Reviews.Content: Standard Sheraton with comfy beds, property is in nice condition. Friendly desk staff, newer lobby decor and free parking. One side faces freeway, they accommodated my request for a room on the quiet side. Indoor-Outdoor pool looked temping on a 96 degree day in June.

Reviews.Title: “Very UNCOOL birthday for my boyfriend!”
Reviews.Author: horsetastic
Reviews.Content: I booked this for my BF's BD. It was convenient and Pet friendly. There was a convention and the pool was closed. I got three different excuses from THREE DIFFERENT PEOPLE as to WHY it was closed. 1) there was an incoming storm (which had already passed), 2) the chemicals were off and 3) the heater wasn't working. The first bad thing other than the pool, were several pieces of pork bone by the bed skirt. Being in the Veterinary field, I have seen many obstructions from pork bones in surgery. I was lucky to pull the fragments out of my dog's throat. This was really upsetting. The maids obviously didn't clean under the skirt. I took pictures and I will try to upload later. The restaurant (pub) took forever to make us food and it was supposed to come with avocado dip and it was just mayonnaise. I asked them to fix this and they just dumped some avocado in there. It tasted really bad too! I don't know if they spit in it in the kitchen or what. I was really sweet about it and the bartender was nice......I'm pretty sure he didn't do it. The bathroom was so tiny that you really don't have any room to turn around and shut the door. The WORST thing about this trip were the incidentals! They were NOT mentioned to me AT ALL when I checked in. I expect more when I use a debit card! Well, I went to Whole foods and spent a bit of money on groceries. Since I didn't know to account for the amount they had put on hold on my card for incidentals (Like $300 bucks or something), My freaking checking account bounced because of them! Luckily my bank covered me, I never do this. The only think I can really say that was nice was the view. Even then, the windows were dirty (not just rain streaked) and it obscured quite a bit of the view. The windows do not open or even have a small vent.....it made the room more claustrophobic and musty. I called and complained, it was that bad. Management never called me back about all the problems we had during our stay. This is the worst Sheraton I've EVER stayed at! I've stayed at 2 star hotels (or less....like CAMPING) and had a better time! Stay over at the Sheraton Market Center. They are WAY nicer and the staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “HARD MATTRESSES!”
Reviews.Author: rosy1961
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the rates on Expedia and it is part of a major chain, so we figured it would be okay. The hotel is conveniently located. However, the mattresses were unusually hard with no mattress toppers, the water control knobs in the shower were hard to turn, had to take a cold shower one morning because their boiler went out, and they have an air conditioning unit that was once manual, now set on thermostat, old unit baseboard type, still functioning, so the room was either too hot or too cold! No information in room on things to do or hotel map. No room service menu in room.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard as a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Civ_iv_fan
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business. This sheraton is okay but i would avoid staying here again. It is probably the worst of the last five or so hotels ive stayed at in the past year. The little things are all wrong. For example, i called guest service after the ice machine didnt work on my floor or the floor below me and i was on hold for 5 minutes. One expects an immediate answer in a decent hotel. Tonight i requested the turn down service and was told "sorry, housekeeping has left for the day" - even though it was 7pm and the pamphlet in the room says the service is available from 6 to 9 pm. Also there was a dirty napkin on my floor that i didnt notice until unpacking, the wifi service is slow and offers a low s ignal despite costing 10.95 per day, and my ironing board is broken. Nothing major, but like i said, the little things are all wrong and when one travels frequently for business, these thigs are expected. I will recommend to the provider of the conference that they choose a different hotel next time. The conference service was also bad, so i expect my concerns will. Ring true. For leksure travel this place is acceptable. Nicer than a days inn. But a westin or hilton it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Galleria Area Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed in 3 different hotels in the Galleria Area in Dallas- This was a terrific experience. Rooms are really nice- If you have club level access- you get the benfits of free breakfast (tips are a good idea to the hostess) and happy hour on the top floor. Free parking, big and clean rooms, nice staff, centrally located- good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: jcl232
Reviews.Content: I came down to Dallas from the Midwest for a little week long getaway. This was a great hotel to stay at. I stayed during the middle of the week, which was a great decision. I booked the Club Level, which was an amazing idea. Every day for breakfast and for dinner appetizers, I would go to the exclusive club level and enjoy the company of the other guests and the concierge that worked there. She was amazing. I have never been to Dallas before and wanted to do some sightseeing and tourist things. The Club Level Lounge is where I learned of all the great things to do. I was so thankful for this place. It was nice, classy, and comfortable. I really enjoyed how it was right off the highway so I could gain access quickly and jump on just as quick. Then there were some amazing restaurants just minutes away from the hotel. I could not have asked for any place better to stay. Also, if youâ€™re into shopping, the big mall, Galleria is literally two blocks away from the hotel. This is was in a great location and made for an amazing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Well located Nice North Dallas Hotel Close to the Galleria”
Reviews.Author: qwovadis
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel up bidding priceline.com for $40 great value.As an SPG.com preferred member they were forced unhappily to supersize me to best available so I got a GREAT suite overlooking the Galleria for that price.Rooms were perfectly renovated bed was the usual AWESOME sheraton bed I slept very well.Staff was not terribly friendly I think probably because I had gotten such a great deal and knew they had to give me an upgrade and held their feet to the fire.Restaurant downstairs had abysmal serivice and mediocre food.Fitness areas were old and poorly laid out.Still for value for me it is a very nice play in a great location.I will return if I can get a great deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Socal_Johnny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for business on two weeknights. I stayed in a corner room at the southeast corner of the 9th floor. The room itself was really quite nice, with high-quality furniture, very comfortable bed, good pillows, good quality sheets. I was especially impressed with the very effective blackout curtains the really blocked every bit of light from the adjacent freeway and airport. With the curtains closed and the lights off, the brightest source of light is from the gap between the room door and the floor. The soundproofing measures taken with the windows seem to be effective. I was able to hear a police car driving on the freeway with sirens on, but otherwise outdoor sounds were absent. Indoor sounds are another matter. This room had an adjoining door to the adjancent room. This inner door wasn't particularly well insulated for sound. I could plainly hear my neighbor's television until 12:30AM. I solved the problem by leaving the AC fan on all night. Business travelers should note that this hotel charges you $10 a day for internet access in your room. I suppose most business travelers will pass this cost on to their company and wouldn't think much of it. I was paying for my trip myself, so the thought of $10 a day for a common convenience was frustrating. Staff were very friendly and helpful. They deserve some credit for their attention to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “not Typical Sheraton Quality”
Reviews.Author: Nativewellness
Reviews.Content: Had several issues with this hotel. Front desk staff not courteous or helpful. Bedsheets had not been changed by housekeeping after we checked in. Had to have Night Manager change them. Have stayed at many Sheraton Hotels over the years. This was by far the worst quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, location good”
Reviews.Author: jakestone
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable, and slept well. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “What great service and accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: RLCgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton and loved the hotel. The check-in was very quick and efficient and the beds were wonderful! Armando Galindo was our check-in host and was always smiling and helpful with any questions that we had. The pool was very clean. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Nice Rooms July 23, 2010”
Reviews.Author: TX0810
Reviews.Content: The rooms we stayed in was nice and looked new, bed was comfortable. Bathrooms kinda small and old looking. Had our 16 month old baby with us and she loved the bed and enjoyed running around the room. They charge for the bottle water in the room and wifi so be warned. Checked out the pool but did not use it, 1/4 of the pool was inside the building and the rest outside. Stayed for 2 nights, housing keeping did not clean our room though. It was around 9 when we back back in and just let is go. Other than that, stay was good and would come back. Hotel is close the Galleria and the tollway w/c was very convenient for me. Parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Frienly staff, nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tali-n-Erez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice and clean. The rooms are good but the bathroom is rather small, the bath itself slippery and has no place for putting the shampoo and staff. Regular rooms has no fridge. We also stayed in a junior suit that wasuchmore comfotable and had a fridge, though bathroom was thw same. The hotel staff is really nice and friendly. Nice buffet breakfast, offering quite a big veriaty. Above all, the great location next to the galleria is Really great, its just a short walk, and you can take the hotel's shuttle for free. Dont let the proximity to the highway scare you, you can not hear it and if you wish they'll give you a room in the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: irfanTX
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located by I 635 and Dallas North Tollway, across from the Galleria. The rooms on the side facing the highway are noisy. The pricing is usually very good, and represents good value. Rooms are well furnished, and the houskeeping is good. Didn't try the restaurant. Free internet access available in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, food in bar well above expectations”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is on the LBJ Freeway, nestled between business buildings and storage facilities. The outside is not so flash - looks like a Wyndham - in fact tell the taxi driver that, it will help them find it. Inside is standard Sheraton, elevators are toward end of life but got me to my floor (card required). I was think this would be a rough night but I would go to my meeting and be back to DFW trying to forget. Things got better - the room had good space, new TV etc, comfortable beds, swimming, fast wireless internet which was not charged for "because we had some criticism about it, rewired it and make it free til the end of the month." Ok, I need food, I am not walking anywhere and I am tired (there is a shuttle bus to Galleria shopping and radius of 15 miles - did not test). The restaurant closes at 10pm and its 10.15. The bar is open for food til 11pm. I am thinking about raiding the nuts and chocolate in the minibar but decide to head down to bar. Bar: There are several big screen TVs, nice area to sit, reasonable wine list by glass, menu has a good range. The lady doing the bar, Jenni, is pleasant, courteous, efficient and non-intrusive but welcoming - offers my choice of TV channels. Food is actually excellent and well priced. I had fish, usually a no-no in TX but it was great. OK. Sleep: good. Shower etc: better than adequate. Meeting: well appointed rooms, no AV problems, excellent breakfast and lunch. Boarding pass: they have a new Sheraton link center in the lobby - free internet on big screen desktops and from your laptop, apparently. Printer. This is a meeting hotel and a stop over for people driving by or using as a hub. I am fussy and cranky when tired. They actually won me, must becoming sentimental as I age ...

Reviews.Title: “Dallas with a smile”
Reviews.Author: GaryZ3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel on 3 occasions and the staff was very friendly. Nice room with small office. I needed audio visual and they went out of their way to accomidate. Restraunt was standard but OK for day to day.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: audreymc13
Reviews.Content: We travel to Dallas frequently and were happy to find such a nice hotel that is also "dog-friendly". The Sheraton North is conveniently located at the intersection of I-635 & the Tollway. It is modern, clean & comfortable. They have a shuttle that will take you to the Galleria (across the Tollway). The staff was incredibly friendly. And best of all, they were extremely open to guests with pets. Believe it or not, there was NO pet deposit. If they stuck us on a "pet floor" we did not notice. The room was clean, the view beautiful and it smelled nice. We've already stayed there twice. And we've recommended it to all of our friends with dogs. We love our puppy and take him everywhere with us. It's nice to stay at a hotel where the staff doesn't turn their noses at us or charge $250 pet fee. We cannot say enough good things about the Sheraton N. If the WiFi were free, it'd be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent meeting hotel”
Reviews.Author: notravelsurprises
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Room and decor very nice. Meeting rooms were user friendly. To a person, staff was very helpful and friendly. Room service was generally prompt, and food was good. Food at group functions was average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, erratic elevators.”
Reviews.Author: Bualabus
Reviews.Content: Clean, well situated hotel with efficient, friendly staff. Located at the intersection of 2 freeways. The fitness center is quite poky, but the equipment was very good, and perhaps the sizing is right, because I hardly ever saw anyone in there. The elevators were just crazy though. The hotel has 15 floors, and you cannot get to your floor without a room key. Furthermore, your floor is the only floor that your room key will take you to when going up, but not when going down. So, with a room on the 15th floor, if you wanted to visit a friend on the 4th, you would need to go to the 15th floor, and then go down to the 4th. On top of that, the room keys themselves were prone to random deactivation. And, when in the elevator with more than one person, the elevator was wont to ignore multiple floor requests, and only stop at the first button pressed. I had issues with this every single day of my stay. One evening, it took me 10 minutes to get from the lobby to my hotel room, due to room key and elevator issues. This is the kind of thing that should really be easy for hotel guests. I stay over 100 nights a year in hotels, so I am not exactly a greenhorn either. Also, the bar shut too early.

Reviews.Title: “Misses the details”
Reviews.Author: cdeen
Reviews.Content: First I have to say the staff at the Sheraton Dallas were fabulous! Every person I came in contact with was friendly and courteous. The hotel however is not what I expected from a Sheraton; the first room I was in was very small and old, I was moved from that room because there was a large bug in it. I was then upgraded to a suite, which was very large, but they miss the details. Such as, there was no book in the room to tell you about the hotel services or the area. There was only one trash barrel and it was in the bathroom, the televisions did not work well. This is a huge hotel, there were not enough signs to direct you where to go for places like the business center. The hot tub was closed during my stay, no sign saying how long it would be closed. It's a non-smoking hotel but I saw lots of cigarette butts in the stairways. I would only stay here again if I had to, it would not be my choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Got it for $35 on Priceline and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nicgrice81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went down to Dallas for a football game (Go 49ers!!!) and to visit relatives near the Galleria area. I saw this hotel on Orbitz for $80 p/night, before I decided I would give Priceline a try. I selected 3.5 star, North Dallas and said I wanted to pay $35 a night and it was approved. The location is excellent. Just off 635 and right by the Galleria. Check-in took 2 minutes and we were on our way up to our room on the 11th floor. You have to insert your room card before selecting your floor. The room was very nice. It had 2 double beds, chair, table and a desk area next to the TV. I like it when I see LCD TV's in hotel rooms. :) The bed was comfy. The lobby was nice. It had a lot of computers with internet access. My husband tried to use the hot tub one morning, but it was covered, so he couldn't. No big deal, he worked out instead. This hotel is excellent. Just check Priceline first! Oh the only downfall is that the bar closes early. We were told it closed at 10 p.m....on a Friday night? No bueno!

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: GottaRun
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, modern and centrally located in Dallas. We booked through Priceline for $35 on a Sunday night, paid to upgrade to a Junior Suite when we arrived and we received a room adjacent to the elevator shaft. Since the parking lot was only one-quarter full and we saw only one other guest, we did not think it to be a problem. WRONG. We heard noise from the elevators all night. If we had paid rack rate, then we would have definitely asked to be moved. No parking fee was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Booked through BetterBidding and Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Andrea in Texas
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I must tell that we paid $40 per night for 2 week-end nights, so I was not expecting too much, even though Priceline shows the hotel at 3 1/2*. The parking lot seemed to confirm my belief as it is a vast asphalt wasteland with signs posted on every vertical surface reminding you to lock your car and hide your valuables. Upon entering the huge lobby my opinion was altered. It is all marble and gleaming and much nicer than what the outside of the hotel would warrant. We had requested and were assigned to a room with a king sized bed, room 1017, facing the downtown skyline. You are required to insert your room key into a slot in the elevator in order for the elevator to go to your floor. This seems to be a secure system, but was inconvenient for visiting friends on the 7th floor as the key ONLY allows access to the floor your room is on. The room and everything inside looked and smelled brand new. The paint had not a single mark on it. Even the towels and linens appeared new. The room was spacious and had the following amenities: Dataport, wifi, flat screen LCD TV, coffee pot with Starbucks coffee and Tazo Tea, hairdryer, alarm clock/radio, ironing board and iron. The a/c was ice cold and that is no small consideration in Texas in the summer. The mattress was very comfortable and the pillows were of good quality. The bathroom is well appointed, with Bliss soaps, shampoos, etc...,but on the small side. Bathtub is of regular size. There is a heat lamp that does not heat much. By far the best "amenity" at the hotel is the FREE shuttle. It goes to the Galleria and to much of Addison. Very handy to be dropped off at the front of the mall instead of having to navigate the huge parking garages there. The only small complaint is the icemaker on our floor was not working and the pool area jacuzzi was closed. Overall, this hotel was a terrific deal and I would even have paid more for it now that I have been there.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: Margie321
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has been remodeled very nicely. But the staff seem indifferent to the needs of their "guests.". On our first night there was no hot water in the entire hotel, which made for a very unpleasant shower. When I called the front desk all I got was a shrug and "the engineers are working on it." Worse, on the second day of our stay our room did not get cleaned. We had a 'do not disturb' sign out early in the morning, but were out from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. We called the front desk and they said the cleaning staff had left for the day, and there was nothing they could do. We had to specifically ask for new towels. I've always enjoyed staying at various Sheraton Hotels, but the management at this place does a disservice to the entire chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: dm713
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Sheraton, actually a very convenient location, right off the interstate and near the Galleria. All in all, it's a fine place, ideal for business travelers. They have a business center right in the lobby with free high-speed internet and printers. Rooms are nice but a bit on the small side, so suggest paying no more than $139/night tops. I would strongly recommend asking for a room facing the back side of the hotel as there is considerable freeway noise on the front side.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by just how helpful the staff were”
Reviews.Author: LeavingOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: My 10th night in a sheraton this year but my first time at this property. I was impressed! I am very pleasantly surprised by how approachable and friendly the staff were. Notables include Peggy and Annita in the club lounge and Louis (the bar) Im planning to return

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy & loud”
Reviews.Author: tigee25
Reviews.Content: We booked through Travelocity and the room was not right when we arrived. There was four of us and one king bed. They brought a roll away in and was going to charge me for it but I had my copy of the reservation that I had booked so then they gave the roll away for free. Good tching I had that with me! We picked this hotel because it is close to the Westin Galleria. There is alot of freeway noise all the time. There was alot of partying, yelling, doors slamming all night long, both nights. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay service, dirty rooms, internet hackers in the business cetner”
Reviews.Author: nyu05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with some colleagues for a business trip. I booked three single rooms with king sized beds, when I got to my room, there were two beds. But when I went downstairs to complain, the man at the front desk said since I booked through Expedia, they don't guarantee rooms. The room was okay, I was somewhat annoyed because there was what looked to be a food stain on the duster of the bed. A little gross. The breakfast was okay, the table dirty and the service was slow. When I checked out, I asked for a receipt, they couldn't give me one saying that since I booked through Expedia, they don't know how much I paid. This would have been fine but the woman at the front desk was outright RUDE. Lastly, when I got home, I noticed some weird things going on with my credit card. Turns out someone hacked my account and added themselves as an authorized user. The only way I can think this happened is someone either was watching or hacked my account when I was in the business center. There were some shady characters there, and I know not to look up financial information at hotels. Overall, no major issues but enough minor ones to make the stay unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff Let In A Burglar to My Room!”
Reviews.Author: travel_fiend_75
Reviews.Content: Warning - this hotel has HORRIBLE security practices. I stayed at this property 9/11-9/14 and, as a Starwood Platinum guest, was given a nice room on the club floor. However, I came back from work to find my Ipod, Bose Headset, and two sets of keys missing! After digging around, it turns out the housekeeping staff admitted to letting a stranger with no ID into my room. There didn't even bother telling me until I reported the crime to the police. After 8 calls to Starwood -and many promises up and down the chain - a week has gone by and I am still waiting on them to provide me a form to submit a claim. Not only was the hotel negligent - they are totally inconsiderate. How hard is it to send out an insurance form??? NEVER STAY HERE. EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: funtravelfamily
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with Prava Suites through Hotwire and were moved to this hotel. This is a nice hotel, with a new remodel. Rooms are comfy and updated with flat screens and Starbucks coffee too. The only problem we had was not getting our room cleaned the second night. The lady asked if we wanted our room cleaned, and we said yes, and we would be leaving soon, only to come back late that night to a dirty room. Hotel staff was not too concerned either. Who knows maybe the lady didn't understand English?? Happy Travels!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: ssmcsmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the potential to be a very nice hotel but seems to have stopped trying. The hot tub was out, the pool area is very stark and would benefit from some plants, the women's restroom at the pool area was out of order, ice machine on our floor was broke...Room was nice enough except for the ancient pepperoni we found on the floor by the drapes. None of these things would matter alone, but all together show a lack of attention to detail and customer care. The worst was the driver who took us to the Galleria Mall in the hotel shuttle. He crammed more people in the van than there was seat belts for. He did not wear a seatbelt. He had the radio set to an offensive rap station full of explicit sexual language. And when I asked him how he was he replied in an annoyed tone "Bored". The best was the rest of the hotel staff who were very friendly and helpful. Would I stay here again? Not for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Average business-class.”
Reviews.Author: tlhughes30
Reviews.Content: Booked room through SPG, used points. Stayed here due to proximity to events in Dallas area, lesser points category. Hotel indeed renovated. Rooms appear new, with flat screen tv. Good. Renovation of common areas (hallways/elevators) not yet complete, I hope. Ambivalent. Speant little time. This hotel will be fine. Just woudn't recommend to a travelista or someone looking for Ritz-type experience (duh- It's a Sheraton!).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: naomiq
Reviews.Content: It is obvious that this hotel has just had some upgrading done. The lobby is very nice and clean. The rooms have new furniture, still smells new. The beds are very comfortable. The guest services staff were all WONDERFUL and very helpful. I loved the shuttle amenity...it'll take you just about anywhere in Addison and pick you up when you are ready, they're pretty quick too. This was my favorite feature about the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: texasbordelon
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and was a little disappointed from the outside. The exterior looked old and unloved and the parking lot was a little scary. However, upon entering the room I was pleasantly surprised. I stayed on the 14th floor (labeled a Starwood Preferred Guest floor, which I am) and the room appeared to have been recently remodeled. Flat screen TV (although with only a couple dozen channels), Starbucks coffee, Bliss soaps and shampoo with a yummy mandarin mint scent, comfortable bed with fluffy white comforter. Very much on par with what I have seen from the newer Sheraton hotels. Good deal for the money ($162 with taxes on a weekday).

Reviews.Title: “Worth the $40/night on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: reharden
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I booked this room on Priceline for $40/night and am very easy to please when it comes to hotels. That being said, this was an average stay at a hotel. Like the reviewer before, I stayed at the hotel when during the Dallas Cup for soccer. It was FULL of teenagers that ran up and down the halls at all hours of the night. They even knocked on our door at midnight. I don't feel that this was the hotels fault, though. The room itself was spacious. We were given a king size bed. It has Tazo tea and Starbucks coffee. The bathroom was extremely small and the tub had more than a few scratches on it. I suspect that they put us in a slightly less than perfect room because we had a pet with us. The hotel respected our "Do Not Disturb" wishes. When we asked for housekeeping, creamer, and a set of towels (over the course of the 4 days were were there), we were greeted by name and they responded quickly to our requests. The fitness center is really great! It is the first treadmill and elliptical I have seen that has a built-in iPod plug and it also has TV capabilities, but I never used the TV. There is a water cooler with cups in the gym. It has three treadmills, two ellipticals, a set of free weights, and an all-in-one resistance station. Fresh towels are also provided. Only two elevators were working and they were really slow. Otherwise, this was an average hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: aanettles
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel and room. Clean, spacious rooms with ammenities ie: Dataport, wifi, lcd tv, coffee pot with starbucks coffee, hairdryer, ironing board and iron. I have to say this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The front desk help was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “brand new sheraton (sort of)”
Reviews.Author: houstontraveler
Reviews.Content: stayed at the sheraton north dallas, which opened on jan 25th, last week. It was actually the wyndom galleria, but now it has new management. I actually booked the hotel thinking it was the wyndom, so it was a surprise when i drove up to a sheraton. With new owners, there are new furnishings, new carpet, etc... it feels like a new hotel. There is construction going on to redo the rooms. The worst noise though was the aircondition/heater turning on at night. Very very noisy. Also the highway could be heard (i 635 is right outside). The location was great...the galleria is a minute away (not close enough to walk, though). The staff was very friendly and kind. The internet connection was free, wireless, and very slow. no fridge or microwave. everything was clean.

Reviews.Title: “great entrance, but went downhill”
Reviews.Author: m8cTexas
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a beautiful lobby and pool area. The kids loved the inside/outside pool. From there, however, it was not as great. The room drastically needed remodeling. There was some construction going on, so maybe they were in the process. The bathroom was unusually small, although had nice amneties for your personal use (shampoo, soaps.) The staff was very friendly and helpful. I wouldn't have wanted to stay longer than a day or so, just due to the room and bathroom. Overall, however it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: OKC_Husker
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay here from all the reviews we read. It is very close to the Galleria- which was nice! We had wine and cheese/crackers awaiting our check-in. (Thanks to signing up for ByRequest) Rooms lacked style. Halls were noisey. Staff was very nice. All in all...not terrible- but probably wont stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tbm0
Reviews.Content: This stay was great from start to finish. The gracious staff and amenities made up for the parts of the hotel which had not yet been renovated. Although I arrived early my room was ready and they allowed me to check in. They apologized that my snack and beverage were not yet in the room and that they had not yet put my hospitality basket [for the event I was attending] in the room. They offered to have a staff person carry the hospitality basket to the room for me. When I returned from lunch and a little bit of sightseeing they had placed a bottle of wine, a box of crackers, cheese, a bottle of water, a pretty glass plate, a cloth napkin, silverware and a wine glass in my room. The wine, cheese and crackers were all high quality products. There was enough that I and my roommate used them for a light lunch the next day. Saturday morning we ate in the restaurant. About the time that the waitress should have been serving our breakfast she appeared very apologeticlly. The cook had just told her that they were out of smoked salmon [an ingredient in my omlet] and would I like to substitute something else or order another dish. I ordered another dish and it was out very quickly. Not only was my breakfast comped but also my roommate's breakfast was comped. Saturday night when we arrived back from the dinner and party there was a voicemail message. The manager had called to find out if I needed any help the next day when I was leaving. She also wanted to know how my stay had been and if there had been any problems. Sunday at noon [check-out time] the hotel system shut off the key cards for all the rooms. They called the event host without prompting and apologized. They offered to make new key cards for anyone who needed them until they left.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but not great”
Reviews.Author: MickeySeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine - but not great. Nothing particularly special about the room - and the reception area was about as warm and comfortable as a mausoleum.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: blakester49
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed in a "junior suite" for the second time in 2 months. The condition of our rooms was excellent both visits. The hotel staff were very good in general. The service from the desk people and room service were excellent for a hotel of this price range during both our visits. Our requests for room service were delivered within 10 minutes every time. The (2nd visit) desk person lowered the price of our room when when we checked in because my wife had mentioned (when she booked it online) we had stayed there a few weeks earlier for a much lower price. The bad stuff: the main restaurant had slow (but friendly) service. Standard hotel fare. The restaurant and pool areas both need a rehab. We did not need to be located near a major consumer mall. The overall location was convienient for us, though. Other than Internet access (standard free direct cable connect and WiFi) I did not use the business facilities of the hotel but they appeared to be first class.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed service there”
Reviews.Author: freekicker
Reviews.Content: I stayed there as a delegate at a Dallas Telco Convention. High quality ambiente, perfect convention atmosphere. Large room, with classic dark furniture. Huge breakfast in traditional manner, light lunches available. Liked the garden. Good location I you want to avoid downtown. Would like to come back

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to the Galleria Mall”
Reviews.Author: cwiley34
Reviews.Content: Before you go make sure you join the Wyndham By Request. By merely doing this...Drinks, Snacks, Extras were all pleasantly staged in my room prior to my arrival. Clean rooms... Friendly staff and OK bed makes this hotel a good choice. My only reccomendation would be for this hotel to upgrade the beds like the Westins. Regarless, all in all a solid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Selected This Hotel Three Times”
Reviews.Author: TravelLadyl
Reviews.Content: We visit our daughters in Dallas every Christmas because they do not have enough room and allows us to not choose between them. Each time we stay multiple nights. I love the way they decorate at Christmas. THIS HOTEL IS A GREAT LOCATION. We can easily drive to our dining favorites and there is wonderful shopping areas nearby. Booking a room on their site is easy and we have found the rates are pretty good. BECOME a member of their "BY REQUEST" club and you will walk in to find refreshments of your choice. We've had no problems so I cannot write about the management. Next Christmas we'll be there again unless their rates become too high.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: AW41
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a stay at the Wyndham. Here are my pros and cons: Pros: -Good rate -Clean and comfortable rooms -Close to the Galleria -Easy parking Cons: -Not a lot of restaurants nearby -Air conditioning was somewhat noisy (although this was not a big deal at all) *As others have noted, I would recommend signing up for the Wyndham by Request. We received fruit, juice, and water in our room and we also had free internet.* This was my second time at the hotel and I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: dlzim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham for 3 nights. It was a wonderful hotel. The staff was super - very attentive. I got a welcoming call, and then another call later in my stay to make sure I had everything I needed. I ordered room service two nights. The food was hot, plentiful, and very good. Because I signed up for Wyndham by Request (free!) I had a great welcoming treat of wine, cheese, and crackers. I highly recommend using this benefit. The bed was comfortable and the linens and pillows just right. The Galleria is walking distance, although there is a free shuttle from the hotel. Overall, I highly enjoyed my stay and would definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: CharlesClark
Reviews.Content: Booked the Wyndham for a weekend getaway to the Galleria. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was helpful and eager to do so. Our 3 year old loved the pool and the free goodie bag you get for being a Wyndham By Request member.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel value”
Reviews.Author: grandisle
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, I would recommend this hotel. Efficent check in, clean, up-dated room and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NonnyMouse
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days here and found the staff to be the most friendly and accomodating of any place I have stayed. If I had a complaint it was that I got TOO much attention in the restaurant; i.e. my water glass was refilled after each sip. Room service was great, the room was very clean and the front desk, concierge and shuttle drivers were cheerful and helpful. There is a regularly scheduled shuttle to the Galleria which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Gave our room away after 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I pre-paid for 4 nights at this hotel. I stayed in the room for two nights. The third night at midnight I returned to the hotel and put my key in the door but it wouldn't work. I went to the front desk to find out what was wrong: they had checked me out of my room and put other people in my room. They didn't even apologize for this debackle and they told me to come back the next day to work out the financial issues. The room was "okay", definitely not updated, pretty old furnishings. The bathtub wouldn't drain (and they didn't fixit after I asked), toilet kept running, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham consistently dependable”
Reviews.Author: jdbhouston
Reviews.Content: I have yet to be disappointed with a stay at a Wyndham, and my recent stay at the Wyndham Dallas North by the Galleria is no exception. I experienced a smooth and pleasant check-in, clean and spacious room, convenient and reasonably priced restaurant (I highly recommend the breakfast buffet!), and easy express check-out. The only thing I noticed that was missing (although not really a problem for me) was that there was no bellman at the door when I arrived. The Galleria shopping center is a 5 minute drive (the hotel offers a shuttle). The location next to LBJ Freeway (I-635) was a concern at first, but I found it to be easy to get around, and I didn't hear ANY traffic in my room that faced the freeway. One big tip: If you choose to make a reservation here, be sure to sign up for the Wyndham ByRequest program beforehand. You can do it online, it's free, and I haven't found any catches so far. The membership gives you. among other things, free highspeed internet access and free local AND long-distance phone calls (yes, free long-distance). And they give you a welcome snack, which you get to choose! It takes effect immediately (you don't have to earn any number of points before the benefits start)...It's unlike any other frequent-stay hotel I know of. I highly recommend the Wyndham Dallas North by the Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas Style”
Reviews.Author: greenmedic
Reviews.Content: I was passing through Dallas on the way to Houston and pre-booked the Wyndham Hotel. It is a business class hotel with budget deals. The rooms were very comfortable and the traffic noise was barely noticeable. The fittings were in good order and clean. The staff were attentive and cheerful. Overall a great place to stay at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on January 25th, 2006 and it was quite simply the worst hotel experience that I have ever had. I travel for business domestically nearly 100 days a year and need to come to Dallas the night before for meetings the next morning. I searched the hotels.com for a hotel of at least 3-stars which could guarantee me a non-smoking room and was able to reserve this Wyndham by the Galleria. When I arrived at 9 pm, they simply booked me into a room on the third floor and when I got the floor it reeked of stale cigarettes. When I opened the room door I was just about bowled over. It smelled like lung cancer. You would shake the bed cover and pillow and small ashes could be seen flying off into the air. I went back downstairs and asked at the front desk that they switch me to a non-smoking room and they said that they had none. I said "how is that possible as I reserved and PREPAID for a non-smoking room?" and they smirked (seriously) and said "read the fine print - we give you the best room that is available considering your request - and there are no non-smoking rooms available". I went back to the room quite upset and thought well then maybe I can just open the window for fresh air. THE WINDOWS DO NOT OPEN! How crazy is that - hundreds of smokers in this room and no ventilation - not even a fan to the outside? I tried to turn on the AC/Heater for fresh air and all it did was stir up the ashes in the room. Bottom line, if you smoke and like hanging out in a stale-smoke room, and like surly management, this is the place for you. Otherwise I strongly recommend that you avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Competent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on a business trip. Room was clean, bed comfortable. Lunch in their restaurant was good and service was fast when I said I was in a hurry. Area around the hotel is not too exciting - not many restaurants and you are right by I-635. But no problems with traffic noise - my room overlooked highway but I didn't hear it. Air conditioner was an annoyance - in-room unit which cycled on and off during the night. Front desk staff not very helpful with local knowledge. I asked for somewhere to go running and they sent me to a non-existent jogging trail. Also the pool is a lot smaller than it looks on their website (but isn't that always the case) Overall, I have no major complaints, though - this hotel gets the basics right, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great hotel! great value! friendly staff, very accomodating. room service food was good and prompt. my filet came in 30 minutes and cooked perfectly. bed was comfortable, feather pillows. rooms spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: worldaviator
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights... as part of the Wyndham ByRequest program, I got a nice plate of 3 fresh baked cookies, bottled water and a can of coke upon entering my room. Complimentary wireless internet via the program which was great....reliable and fast! Bed was comfortable as was the spacious rooms. Only drawback was how often the a/c unit kept on turning on / off. Location near Dallas Galleria is a definite plus... tried the breakfast buffet and it was average. Coworker had room service and was pleased with service and food. Overall, I'd recommend staying at this hotel in North Dallas. Would have loved to see a self-service laundry machine. Also, nice swimming pool area that opens outside/inside, with sauna and health club, which was average.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Dallas Hotel by the Galleria
HotelInfo.Address: 4801 Lyndon B. Johnson Freeway, Dallas, TX 75244 (Formerly Sheraton Dallas North Hotel by the Galleria)
